comments:
A Java search of "//xyz" will result in a internal error.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.jdt.core.search.SearchEngine.search(SearchEngine.java:701)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.core.search.SearchEngine.search(SearchEngine.java:669)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.search.JavaSearchQuery.run(JavaSearchQuery.java:100)
	at
org.eclipse.search2.internal.ui.InternalSearchUI$InternalSearchJob.run(InternalSearchUI.java:70)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:62)

SearchEngine.createSearchPatten(String, int, int, boolean) returns null as 
specified (because the string pattern is ill-formed). UI should check for null 
before passing it to the search(...) method.

I have added error handling code. However, I'm not happy with it because I can't
tell the user what is wrong with the search pattern. What I'd like to show is
the reason the pattern is invalid/not supported. Could core supply that (for
example, throw a core exception?).
Moving back to core for consideration.
This would be a breaking API change.
Call the method something else, then.
*** Bug 53108 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
